comments.body:
I believe this line (and the one above for macro originals) is a performance regression. Both `foreach` and `traverse` will recurse into the tree. See https://github.com/sbt/zinc/pull/187

Either `t.original.foreach(handleTreeNode)` or simply `traverse(t.original)` seems to be the right approach.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +135,139 @@      // not what we need
      case t: TypeTree if t.original != null =>
        t.original.foreach(traverse)
      case t if t.hasSymbol && eligibleAsUsedName(t.symbol) =>
        addSymbol(t.symbol)
